thread.title: NYC: Opioid Crisis Has Cost City $500 Million

author: Corinne Ramey
title: NYC: Opioid Crisis Has Cost City $500 Million
text:
Mayor Bill de Blasio offered few specifics when he said New York City litigation would seek about $500 million from opioid manufacturers and distributors to recover costs associated with abuse of the drugs.
The breakdown of that half billion offers a window into how the opioid epidemic has taxed the city, with most of it borne by its financially strapped public-health system.
The... RELATED VIDEO The Way to Save Opioid Addicts | Moving Upstream Addiction experts are in wide agreement on the most effective way to help opioid addicts: Medication-assisted treatment. But most inpatient rehab facilities in the U.S. don’t offer this option. WSJ’s Jason Bellini reports on why the medication option is controversial, and in many places, hard to come by.
